business.headline: Air India cuts 15% of international ops till mid-July citing checks, global unrestAir India has temporarily cut 15% of its international widebody flights until mid-July due to Middle East tensions, airspace curfews in Europe and East Asia, and increased safety measures following recent disruptions. This comes after the June 12 Ahmedabad plane crash.

Dassault, Reliance Infrastructure to make Falcon 2000 business jets in IndiaDassault said it aims to deliver the first made-in-India jets by 2028 for corporate and military use, and will cater to rising demand in both Indian and international markets.
Sensex ends 138 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Titan down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 138.64 points to close at 81,444.66, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.35 points to end at 24,812.05.

IPO market heats up with Rs 26,000 crore fundraising in JuneA resurgence in initial public offerings is evident as several major companies plan to launch IPOs in June and July, raising substantial funds.

Explained: Why BSE shares are falling today The drop comes as the company announced a shift in the expiry day of its equity derivative contracts from Tuesdays to Thursdays, effective from September 1, after regulatory approval.

DLF's Rs 11,000 crore Privana North luxury project sells out in a weekSituated in the expansive 116-acre township in Gurugram, this project notched up sales beyond Rs 11,000 crore, highlighting the robust market appetite for premium homes in India's big cities.

Is buying a home in major Indian cities a mistake? Financial advisor explainsFinancial advisor Lovish Anand questions the wisdom of homeownership in high-cost Indian metros, highlighting the economic realities of renting versus buying.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares rose 6% todayOver the last year, IndusInd Bank's stock had fallen by 43.51%. However, it has shown signs of recovery in recent weeks, rising around 8.63% in the past month.

Middle class has eroded: Startup founder flags growing financial stress in IndiaOnce a marker of steady growth, India's middle class now faces rising costs, slower salary gains, and shifting financial priorities in an economy where old assumptions no longer hold true.
Sensex, Nifty rise as markets stay calm despite Iran-Israel flare-upThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 70.97 points to 81,654.27, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 44.50 points to 24,897.90 as of 9:28 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusOswal Pumps IPO allotment is set to be finalised on June 18, 2025, after a robust subscription. Investors can check their allotment status through BSE and Link Intime.

Indian stock market to open flat as Middle East tensions raise oil pricesAs of 8:23 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,852. This suggests that Nifty50 is likely to begin the day close to Tuesday's closing level of 24,853.4.

entertainment.headline: Springsteen Deliver Me From Nowhere trailer: Jeremy Allen White shines as music legendActor Jeremy Allen White is all set to portray American rock legend Bruce Springsteen in upcoming biopic. The trailer for the film, titled 'Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere' was released on June 18.

Censor board cuts 19 Scenes from Dhanush, Nagarjuna's Kuberaa ahead of releaseSekhar Kammula's 'Kuberaa', starring Dhanush, Nagarjuna, Rashmika Mandanna, and Jim Sarbh, has received a UA certificate from the CBFC after 19 scenes were trimmed from the original cut.

Genelia Deshmukh on accidental marriage rumours with John Abraham: No truth to itGenelia Deshmukh has shut down rumours that she accidentally married John Abraham during the shoot of 'Force'. She called the rumours baseless and PR-driven.

Apoorva Mukhija plans to move abroad, says Mumbai feels too accessibleContent creator Apoorva Mukhija plans to leave Mumbai to pursue a master's degree abroad. She said the city feels too accessible and has limited growth. She also shared that achieving fame feels underwhelming, even after major milestones like appearing on billboards.

F1 movie review: Brad Pitt delivers the most enjoyable film of the yearReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025F1 movie review: Brad Pitt stars as an ageing racer in the adrenaline-fuelled F1 movie. The film delivers high-octane action and strong performances, promising a thrilling theatre experience, says our review.

SRK's hearty bond over Baazigar, 70-minute line with Sitaares of Aamir's film. WatchShah Rukh Khan surprised Aamir Khan and 'Sitaare Zameen Par' cast on the film's set. In a BTS video, the superstar is seen hugging everyone while striking his signature pose.

Dheeme Dheeme in Croatia: Kartik Aaryan, Ananya recreate steps in now-deleted videoKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday recreated 'Dheeme Dheeme' steps in the now-deleted video. This comes as Panday wrapped the Croatian shooting schedule.

The Hunt trailer: Nagesh Kukunoor's series explores Rajiv Gandhi assassination caseThe trailer of 'The Hunt: The Rajiv Gandhi Assassination Case' is out. The series, directed by Nagesh Kukunoor, is based on the bestselling book Ninety Days by investigative journalist Anirudhya Mitra.

Zayed Khan: Sussanne and Hrithik are still soulmates even after divorceZayed Khan has spoken about the relationship between actor Hrithik Roshan and his ex-wife Sussanne Khan. He said the couple, who separated in 2014, are still soulmates.

ADOR wins third legal battle against NewJeans over management rightsSeoul High Court rules in favour of ADOR for the third time in a dispute with NewJeans. The verdict reinforces ADOR's exclusive management rights amid growing fan anticipation for the group's third anniversary.

I gave everything for my loved ones...: Abhishek Bachchan shares cryptic postActor Abhishek Bachchan recently shared an emotional post on social media reflecting on life philosophy, solitude, self-identity and inner-peace.

Tahira Kashyap recalls going broke after marriage: Ayushmann didn't understand…Ayushmann Khurrana's wife-filmmaker, Tahira Kashyap, recently shared an emotional anecdote about the time when the actor didn't realise who was handling their home expenses.

Hollywood superheroes inspired by Indian mythology: Akshay KumarActor Akshay Kumar, who will be seen in the upcoming mythological film 'Kannappa', said Hollywood superheroes and their superpowers are inspired by Indian mythology.

Ankit Siwach on Bahadur 120: Playing a soldier is a spiritual journeyActor Ankit Siwach opened up about his role in Farhan Akhtar's '120 Bahadur'. He mentioned how playing a soldier is like a dream come true for him.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office prediction: Will Aamir Khan be back to rule?Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is set to hit theatres on June 20. IndiaToday.in spoke to trade experts to gauge the pre-release buzz of the film, and understand its opening weekend performance prediction.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali says there was lot of love on Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam setsFilmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali talked about actors Salman Khan and Aishwarya Rai's chemistry in 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam'.  The film completed 26 years of release on June 18.

Samantha reacts to rumours of promoting Yeh Maaya Chesave ahead of re-releaseIn a recent interview, Samantha Ruth Prabhu addressed rumours about reuniting with ex-husband Naga Chaitanya to promote the re-release of their 2010 hit film, 'Yeh Maaya Chesave '.

Jonathan Bailey on choosing Jurrasic World: Struck a chord with the nerd in me'Bridgerton' actor Jonathan Bailey opened up about why he signed 'Jurassic World Rebirth'. He will portray Dr Henry Loomis in the upcoming actioner.

Add PM Modi quote, remove lotus: Censor board suggests 5 edits to Sitaare Zameen ParThe censor board on Monday reportedly passed 'Sitaare Zameen Par' with a U/A 13+ certificate. Here's the list of changes that the board recommended to the Aamir Khan starrer.

general news.headline: Trump privately approved attack plans for Iran but withheld final order: ReportUS President Trump approved plans to strike Iran but delayed the final order, awaiting Iran's move on its nuclear program. A military build-up is underway as tensions rise, with over 450 dead in Iran and 24 in Israel, according to reports.

Live: US planning attack on Iran this weekend, says reportIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other for the seventh consecutive day. In a live address, Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei declared that the nation remains united and will not bow to external pressure. Responding to US President Donald Trump's call for Iran to surrender, Khamenei issued a stern warning that any American military strike would lead to "serious irreparable consequences". Trump, on whether the US will attack Iran, said, "I may do it, I may not do it. I mean, nobody knows what I'm going to do." Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Zia-Musharraf-Munir: Why the US needs Pakistan's dictatorsA 1947 British war memo shows why Pakistan, not India, suited post-imperial interests — creating a pliant state on Soviet, Iranian, and Arabian frontiers. In 2025, that logic still holds.

Voting begins for Assembly bypolls in 4 states, key test for NDA and INDIA bloc  Live UpdatesAssembly bypolls for five seats across Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala begin today. High-stakes contests and alliance dynamics are at play ahead of major state elections.

The film delivers high-octane action and strong performances, promising a thrilling theatre experience, says our review.

What Donald Trump said on Iran-Israel conflict after meeting Pak's Asim MunirUS President Trump met Pakistan Army Chief Asim Munir, discussing the Iran-Israel conflict and South Asian stability. The meeting, held in the Cabinet Room, was followed by a formal luncheon.

Flight carrying 110 Indian students evacuated from Iran lands in DelhiA flight carrying 110 Indian students evacuated from war-hit Iran landed safely in Delhi on Thursday morning. Families expressed relief, and urged help for those still stranded in Tehran.

Ayatollah's nephew calls for regime's fall: No peace without disappearanceThe Israel-Iran war is now in its second week, and a stunning call for regime collapse has emerged from within Iran's ruling family. From exile, Mahmoud Moradkhani says the Islamic Republic must fall — by any means necessary.

US resumes student visas with mandatory social media screening for applicantsThe US has resumed student visa processing, now requiring applicants to share public social media accounts for vetting, aiming to detect anti-US content in a sweeping new security screening measure.

PM Modi fact-checks Trump, the only way it could have been doneAfter nearly 14 claims of the US brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has given a no-nonsense response to Donald Trump, countering the US's ceasefire mediation narrative. Here's how it is a lesson in diplomacy.

Trump hosted Pak's Asim Munir after he backed Nobel Peace Prize bid: White HouseThe White House confirmed the meeting through spokesperson Anna Kelly, who said the visit came in light of Munir's remarks hailing Trump's role in halting what could have been a devastating escalation between the two nuclear-armed neighbours.

May, may not, nobody knows what I'll do: Trump on joining Israeli attacks on IranDonald Trump claimed that Iran had proposed holding talks at the White House, though he did not elaborate on the nature or timing of the outreach. He went on to describe Iran as "totally defenceless, with no air defence whatsoever".
At G7, PM calls out West's double standards on terrorismAt the 51st G7 summit held in Kananaskis, Canada, PM Modi pressed for global unity on terrorism and technology.

Landed on soft soil, no blast on plane: How lone survivor escaped Air India crashTop sources informed India Today TV the reason behind his miraculous escape - Viswashkumar Ramesh landed in the narrow gap between two buildings where loose soil had been piled up, cushioning his fall and saving his life.

Trump wants 'total and complete victory' in Iran, rules out ceasefireUS President Trump ruled out calls for a ceasefire, demanding "total and complete victory" to stop Iran's nuclear ambitions. He warned of US capabilities, hinted at restraint, and said no final decision has been made.

This state is likely to roll back the 5-day work week in government officesA political storm erupted after the BJP-led government announced the decision to roll back the five-day work week programme in government offices, which was implemented in 2022.

I gave everything for my loved ones...: Abhishek Bachchan shares cryptic postActor Abhishek Bachchan recently shared an emotional post on social media reflecting on life philosophy, solitude, self-identity and inner-peace.

No trade deal talk or US mediation behind Pak truce: PM gets blunt with TrumpDonald Trump has repeatedly claimed that he mediated the ceasefire between India and Pakistan last month and the threat of cutting off trade forced the countries to stop the hostilities.

Bhupesh Baghel among flyers stranded after IndiGo flight door fails to openFormer Chhattisgarh Chief Minister and Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel was among the flyers stuck inside an IndiGo flight after its door failed to open for 30 minutes.

Shubman Gill will bat at No.4: Rishabh Pant confirms batting spot for India captainRishabh Pant has confirmed that India's new Test captain Shubman Gill will be batting at No.4 during the first Test against England, starting from June 20.

What Mark Carney said on Nijjar killing after bilateral meet with PM ModiCanadian Prime Minister Mark Carney appeared cautious as he commented on discussions he had with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the June 2023 killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar in British Columbia.

Fighting on Twitter? PM's joke with Macron, big laugh, Trump chatter onlineAt the G7 Summit, PM Narendra Modi told the French President, Emmanuel Macron, "Nowadays, you are fighting on Twitter," drawing laughter and setting off a viral wave online. Social media users quickly connected the remark to Macron's recent spat with US President Donald Trump.

Salman Khan jokes about Aamir finding love at 60, tells Kapil he has his own leagueComedian Kapil Sharma asked Salman Khan to take inspiration from his friend and actor Aamir Khan, who is still searching for love at 60. The superstar gave a funny response and then burst into laughter.

Sam Altman says Meta made big money move to steal OpenAI talent but failedOpenAI CEO Sam Altman publicly accused Meta of offering $100 million bonuses to poach staff, revealing details usually kept private in Silicon Valley's escalating race to hire top AI talent.

sports.headline: Chelsea's Mudryk faces potential four-year ban after FA doping chargeMykhailo Mudryk's career hangs in the balance as the Chelsea winger faces a possible four-year suspension following FA doping charges, marking a dramatic fall from grace for the €89 million signing.

Rohit Sharma gifts Ayush Mhatre signed bat ahead of India U-19's England tourIn a heartwarming post on social media, Ayush Mhatre revealed that he got a signed bat from Rohit Sharma as a gift on Wednesday, June 18. Mhatre will be leading the Indian U-19 team for their tour of England.

Real Madrid vs Al Hilal, FIFA Club World Cup: Stage set for Xabi era's unveilingXabi Alonso begins his Real Madrid managerial journey with high expectations as the club kicks off their FIFA Club World Cup campaign against Al Hilal—his first real test after a trophyless season for Los Blancos.

Shubman Gill and I have a really good camaraderie off the field: Rishabh PantRishabh Pant opened up on his relationship with new India Test captain Shubman Gill and said that he gels really well with the 25-year-old on and off the field. Pant will act as Gill's deputy as he begins his time as the new skipper of the Indian team in the longest format of the game.

Rishabh Pant relieved he won't face Anderson-Broad duo in England TestsRishabh Pant admitted he's relieved not to face James Anderson and Stuart Broad in the upcoming England Test series, with both legendary pacers having retired and not part of India's challenging tour.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma big losses, but India has enough depth: Brydon CarseBrydon Carse admitted that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will be big misses for India during their tour of England, but said that the visitors have enough depth in their lineup to put up a challenge. Kohli and Rohit retired from Test cricket ahead of the tour.

Mushfiqur, Shanto lead BAN charge before SL fight back late on Day 2Bangladesh dominated early on Day 2 through stellar knocks from Mushfiqur Rahim, Najmul Hossain Shanto, and Litton Das, but Sri Lanka hit back late with a sharp bowling display to leave the Galle Test intriguingly balanced heading into Day 3.

Garcia joins Barca's stacked goalkeeper department that already has Marc-Andre Ter Stegen and Wojciech Szczesny.

WTC winners South Africa get heroes' welcome as Bavuma leads homecomingSouth Africa's Test team returned home to a rousing heroes' welcome after their historic WTC Final win over Australia, with captain Temba Bavuma proudly leading the squad and holding the championship mace aloft.

Bethell vs Pope for No.3: Rob Key feels Headingley call won't define careersRob Key feels that the battle between Ollie Pope and Jacob Bethell for the No.3 spot for the Headingley Test won't end up defining their careers. Both men have staked a claim for the spot with their strong performances in recent times.

Rohit won't be missed as much as Kohli by Indian team: Geoffrey BoycottFormer England opener Geoffrey Boycott feels Rohit Sharma won't be missed as much as Virat Kohli in Test cricket. Boycott also explained why Kohli may have decided to retire from Test cricket ahead of the England tour.

Suryakumar Yadav travels to London for possible sports hernia surgeryIndia T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has flown to London for a medical consultation regarding a sports hernia. The injury may require surgery, which could impact his availability for India's upcoming T20I series in August.

Premier League: Manchester City name Bernardo Silva as new captainBernardo Silva has been named Manchester City captain ahead of the new season. Pep Guardiola decided to ditch the usual method and personally named Silva as the skipper and Rodri, Ruben Dias and Erling Haaland as the vice-captains.

Coach Gautam Gambhir joins India squad in Leeds ahead of first TestIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir returned to the national squad in Leeds just in time for the first Test against England, bringing experience and direction back into the camp after briefly stepping away due to a family emergency.

Women's T20 World Cup 2026 schedule: IND vs PAK on June 14, final at Lord'sThe full schedule for the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2026 has been unveiled, with the tournament set to take place across England and Wales. The competition will get underway on June 12 and will run for 24 days.

Club World Cup: Kylian Mbappe doubtful for Real Madrid's opening fixture vs Al HilalReal Madrid are hoping Kylian Mbappe makes a full recovery after the forward fell ill ahead of their opening FIFA Club World Cup match against Al-Hilal.

Premier League: Manchester City name Bernardo Silva as new captainBernardo Silva has been named Manchester City captain ahead of the new season. Pep Guardiola decided to ditch the usual method and personally named Silva as the skipper and Rodri, Ruben Dias and Erling Haaland as the vice-captains.

Coach Gautam Gambhir joins India squad in Leeds ahead of first TestIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir returned to the national squad in Leeds just in time for the first Test against England, bringing experience and direction back into the camp after briefly stepping away due to a family emergency.

Women's T20 World Cup 2026 schedule: IND vs PAK on June 14, final at Lord'sThe full schedule for the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2026 has been unveiled, with the tournament set to take place across England and Wales. The competition will get underway on June 12 and will run for 24 days.

Club World Cup: Kylian Mbappe doubtful for Real Madrid's opening fixture vs Al HilalReal Madrid are hoping Kylian Mbappe makes a full recovery after the forward fell ill ahead of their opening FIFA Club World Cup match against Al-Hilal.

Emotional Umesh Yadav yearns for India comeback: I can't select myselfIndia fast bowler Umesh Yadav is yearning to make a comeback to the Indian team, having not played for the country for over two years. Umesh last played for India in the World Test Championship final against Australia.

Premier League 2025-26 fixtures: Manchester United face Arsenal in opening weekManchester United will host Arsenal in the first Super Sunday clash of the 2025/26 Premier League season, with Liverpool, Manchester City, Chelsea, and FA Cup winners Crystal Palace also playing on a bumper opening weekend.

Root on how Bazball works: More method to it than probably perceivedJoe Root opened up about what it means to play the Bazball way, highlighting how the past few years have been among the most enjoyable of his career—especially as he was one of the highest run-scorers in the previous World Test Championship campaign.

England plotting 'all-out attack' on India with tailor-made Leeds pitchEngland are planning an all-out attack against India in the first Test at Headingley, Leeds, beginning from June 20, with a tailor-made pitch to support their aggressive batting approach.

Joe Root dissects Virat Kohli's off-stump woes: Technical changes can backfireStar England batter Joe Root has shared his views on Virat Kohli's outside off-stump woes, saying that it gets difficult for a batter to make changes midway through the series with little turnaround time.

Spurs chairman explains Ange Postecoglou exit: We need to win Premier LeagueTottenham Hotspur chairman Daniel Levy felt that removing Ange Postecoglou as manager was necessary, believing the club needed to compete strongly on all fronts. Despite winning the Europa League, the team had a disappointing domestic season, finishing 17th in the Premier League.

India will miss Virat Kohli's fighting spirit in Test series: Ben StokesEngland captain Ben Stokes has praised Virat Kohli, saying India will miss his "fighting spirit" during the upcoming five-match Test series against England, which begins on 20 June.

Setback for BCCI as court affirms Rs 538-crore arbitral awards to Kochi TuskersIn a major blow to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI), the Bombay High Court has upheld arbitral awards totalling over Rs 538 crore in favour of the former Indian Premier League (IPL) franchise Kochi Tuskers Kerala.

Mohammed Shami faced Biryani criticism, responded with five wickets: Ravi ShastriFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri has recently revealed how he called out fast bowler Mohammed Shami for having a large plate of Biryani and the speedster replied with a match-winning five wicket haul.

Maxwell emulates Rohit Sharma with superb T20 hundred for Washington FreedomAustralian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell equalled the likes of David Warner and Aaron Finch, Indian legend Rohit Sharma, and England's Jos Buttler as the player with the joint-fourth-most centuries in T20 cricket. Maxwell notched his eighth century in the shortest format during a Major League Cricket (MLC) match for his team, Washington Freedom (WSF).

India Test series as commercially important as Ashes: ECB chief executiveThe upcoming five-match Test series between India and England is commercially as important as the Ashes, according to ECB Chief Executive Richard Gould.

Simone Inzaghi downplays Al-Hilal agreement timeline: Gave everything to InterSimone Inzaghi said he gave his all to Inter Milan before becoming the new manager of Al-Hilal earlier this month. Inzaghi made these remarks after Al-Hilal's CEO said that the move had been agreed before Inter's 5-0 loss to Paris St Germain in the Champions League final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
